query: Investigate Ali Khaledi Nasab an Irani AI Researcher working for Amazon
tasks: Search LinkedIn for current role and professional details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon Research
Check Google Scholar for academic publications by Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI and Machine Learning
Search Iranian and US university alumni databases for educational background
Review Amazon Research team pages and press releases for professional mentions

task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for current role and professional details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon Research
task_1.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently serving as a Principal Research Scientist in Product Knowledge at Amazon. He is based in Seattle, Washington. ([amazon.science](https://www.amazon.science/author/ali-khaledi?utm_source=openai))

Originally from Iran, Dr. Khaledi moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy at Ohio University. His doctoral research focused on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites. He received the American Physical Society's 2019 Student Travel Award to present his work at the annual APS meeting in Boston. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

After completing his Ph.D., Dr. Khaledi joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, where he collaborated on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders, including Parkinson's disease. He then worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on epilepsy treatments. In October 2022, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS Network Capacity Planning organization. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on a new generative AI product. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi is also an adjunct professor of Physics at Ohio University and has contributed to the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for "significant contributions" in Clinical Medicine. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In 2023, he was invited to the Nobel Peace Prize ceremony in Oslo, an experience he found both enjoyable and enriching. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Dr. Khaledi is passionate about continuous learning, dedicating time daily to reading and taking courses. He values Amazon's commitment to learning, aligning with the company's core leadership principle, "Learn and Be Curious." ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: Ali Khaledi - Amazon Science
Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_2.query_used: Check Google Scholar for academic publications by Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI and Machine Learning
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a researcher affiliated with Amazon, specializing in machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

His academic contributions encompass a diverse range of topics, including:

- **Nanotechnology**: He co-authored a study on the green synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles using potato extract, highlighting their potential applications in nanoscience. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

- **Quantum Physics**: He investigated the optical properties of InAs/GaAs quantum dots, focusing on the effects of wetting layers on dispersion curves. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

- **Computational Neuroscience**: He explored the impact of coordinated reset stimulation on neural networks, contributing to the understanding of desynchronization effects in plastic neural networks. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

These publications reflect his interdisciplinary approach, bridging fields such as nanotechnology, quantum physics, and neuroscience through the application of machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques.

citations.title: ‪Ali Khaledi-Nasab‬ - ‪Google Scholar‬
‪Ali Khaledi-Nasab‬ - ‪Google Scholar‬

task_3.query_used: Search Iranian and US university alumni databases for educational background
task_3.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a graduate student in Physics & Astronomy at Ohio University. He has been involved in research focusing on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. In October 2017, he delivered a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster titled "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements." His research has been supervised by Dr. Alexander Neiman, a Professor of Physics & Astronomy at Ohio University. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

In May 2019, Khaledi Nasab received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the annual APS meeting in Boston. At the conference, he presented his paper titled "Dynamics of excitable tree networks: Application to sensory neurons." His research aims to understand the dynamical principles of functioning and information processing in sensory neurons with tree-like morphologies. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

While specific details about his undergraduate education are not readily available, his current doctoral studies at Ohio University suggest a strong background in physics and related disciplines.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Gives Colloquium Talk at College of Wooster - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_4.query_used: Review Amazon Research team pages and press releases for professional mentions
task_4.data: Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon's Rufus division. He joined Amazon in October 2022 as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to focus on generative AI products. Prior to Amazon, he held a postdoctoral position at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery and worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup. His research interests encompass machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_6.query_used: Check news archives and tech media sites for professional profile or interview mentions
task_6.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon. Originally from Iran, he moved to the U.S. in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. After completing his doctorate, he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery for a research position. He later worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup focused on developing treatments for epilepsy. In 2022, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. In 2024, he transitioned to Amazon Rufus to work on a new generative AI product. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In 2017, Khaledi Nasab shared his experiences as an international student in the U.S. in a column titled "Standing Up to Fear" published in *Science* magazine. He discussed the challenges faced by international students amid changing political climates and emphasized the importance of institutional support. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/04/graduate-student-science-standing-fear/?utm_source=openai))

In 2019, he received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics 2019 Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the annual APS meeting in Boston, where he presented his research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, in 2017, he was invited to give a colloquium talk at the College of Wooster's Department of Physics, discussing his work on emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2017/10/khaledi-nasab-gives-colloquium-talk-college-wooster/?utm_source=openai))

For more detailed information about his professional journey and research, you can visit his personal website. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

task_8.query_used: Review professional networking sites like ResearchGate for academic and research connections
task_8.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist specializing in the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons with branched myelinated terminals. His research has been disseminated through various academic platforms, including ResearchGate and Academia.edu.

On ResearchGate, Khaledi Nasab has shared his doctoral thesis titled "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks," which delves into the collective behavior of diffusively coupled excitable elements in small tree networks. This work models sensory neurons with branched myelinated terminals, aiming to understand mechanisms of spike generation and information coding in these neurons. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/figure/The-classifications-of-neurons-based-on-the-branches-that-originate-from-the-cell-body_fig1_334373044?utm_source=openai))

Additionally, he has contributed to discussions on synaptic plasticity, exploring its role in the reorganization of neural circuits and its potential therapeutic applications. His insights into the dynamical aspects of activity-dependent synaptic plasticity have been featured in academic publications. ([researchgate.net](https://www.researchgate.net/figure/Spike-timing-dependent-plasticity-Synaptic-weight-increment-vs-spike-timing-difference_fig1_363230817?utm_source=openai))

Through these contributions, Khaledi Nasab has engaged with the academic community, sharing his research findings and perspectives on neural dynamics and plasticity.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 12, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working as a Principal Research Scientist at Amazon.  His background includes academic research in physics, neuroscience, and AI, as well as industry experience at Amazon, Stanford University, and CODA Biotherapeutics.  No legal or regulatory issues were identified in the provided summaries.


### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
- Principal Research Scientist, Product Knowledge at Amazon (Seattle, WA)
- Research Scientist, AWS Network Capacity Team at Amazon (Start Date: 2022)
- Research Scientist, Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products (2024)
- Postdoctoral position, Department of Neurosurgery, Stanford University
- CODA Biotherapeutics


**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
- Amazon
- Stanford University
- CODA Biotherapeutics

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
- No legal or regulatory issues found based on provided data.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
- PhD in Physics and Astronomy, Ohio University (research focused on dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons with myelinated dendrites)
- Colloquium talk, "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements" at the College of Wooster (October 2017)
- Research on green synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles.
- Doctoral thesis, "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks"
-  American Physical Society's 2019 Student Travel Award.

**5. Online / Social Media**
- Presence on Amazon Science author page.
- Profile on Google Scholar.
- Personal Website ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))
- ResearchGate profile.


**6. Additional Observations**
- Moved from Iran to the U.S. in 2014 to pursue Ph.D.
- Research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics.
- No patents found associated with his name.
- No specific conference proceedings identified.

### Risk Score
Low.  Based on the available information, Ali Khaledi Nasab presents a low reputational risk profile. He has a consistent and positive academic and professional trajectory with no indications of legal or regulatory issues.

judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 12, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working as a Principal Research Scientist at Amazon. His background includes academic research in physics, neuroscience, and AI, with industry experience at Amazon, Stanford University, and CODA Biotherapeutics. No legal or regulatory issues were identified.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
- Principal Research Scientist, Product Knowledge at Amazon (Seattle, WA)¹
- Research Scientist, AWS Network Capacity Team at Amazon (October 2022)¹⁴
- Research Scientist, Amazon Rufus, focusing on generative AI products (2024)¹⁴
- Postdoctoral position, Department of Neurosurgery, Stanford University¹
- CODA Biotherapeutics (gene therapy startup focused on epilepsy treatments)¹

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
- Amazon (current employer)
- Stanford University (former postdoc)
- CODA Biotherapeutics (former employer)
- Ohio University (PhD institution)

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
- No legal or regulatory issues found based on provided data.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
- PhD in Physics and Astronomy, Ohio University³
  - Doctoral thesis: "Collective Dynamics of Excitable Tree Networks"⁸
  - Research focused on dynamics of excitable tree networks in sensory neurons
  - Supervised by Dr. Alexander Neiman³
- American Physical Society's 2019 Student Travel Award¹³⁶
- Colloquium talk at College of Wooster (October 2017): "Emergent stochastic oscillations and signal detection in tree networks of excitable elements"³
- Published column "Standing Up to Fear" in Science magazine (2017)⁶
- Research contributions:
  - Green synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles using potato extract²
  - Optical properties of InAs/GaAs quantum dots²
  - Coordinated reset stimulation effects on neural networks²

**5. Online / Social Media**
- Amazon Science author page¹
- Google Scholar profile²
- Personal Website (alikhaledi.com)¹⁴⁶
- ResearchGate profile⁸

**6. Additional Observations**
- Moved from Iran to the U.S. in 2014 to pursue Ph.D.¹
- Research interests: machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics²⁴
- No patents found in U.S. or Iranian patent databases⁵
- No specific conference proceedings identified in searches⁷

### Risk Score
Low. Based on verified information, Ali Khaledi Nasab presents a low reputational risk profile with a consistent academic and professional trajectory.

### Data Limitations
- Claims about Nobel Peace Prize attendance (2023), adjunct professorship at Ohio University, and Encyclopedia contributions could not be verified through provided evidence
- Limited information on undergraduate education
- Conference presentation history incomplete despite academic career

---
¹ Amazon Science author page, personal website (alikhaledi.com)
² Google Scholar citations
³ Ohio Forum - College of Wooster colloquium (2017)
⁴ Personal website (alikhaledi.com)
⁵ Patent database search results
⁶ Ohio Forum - Science magazine column (2017)
⁷ Conference proceedings search results
⁸ ResearchGate profile
